items.question: What is the difference between a PRP Facial and Vampire Facial?

children.text: They are the same treatment. PRP Facial is the medical term, while Vampire Facial is its popular name.
Yes = since it uses your own blood plasma, there’s no risk of allergy or rejection. At

items.question: How many sessions are required for the PRP Facial?

children.text: , spaced 4 weeks apart, give the best results for acne scars, anti-ageing, and under-eye rejuvenation.

items.question: When will I see results from my PRP Facial?

children.text: A healthy glow appears within a week. Collagen stimulation from the
continues to improve skin texture and elasticity over 2–4 weeks.

items.question: How long do results last from my PRP Facial?

children.text: typically last 12–18 months, depending on lifestyle, skincare routine, and maintenance sessions.

items.question: Can PRP Facial help with acne scars?
